name: 1940s black satin double breasted Hardy Amies tailored evening suit jacket
description:
Very chic and typically 1940s styled black satin evening jacket by Royal tailors Hardy Amies. The jacket is double breasted and nipped in at the waist, pockets to the front. Art deco style diamond-shaped buttons. The style is very reminiscent of the 1970s versions of these garments, so will work well for a boutique-inspired outfit too Will best fit a UK 12/14 - designed to be slightly oversized Will best fit a UK 8/10 - please note the jacket is quite narrow across the back as it was probably custom made for someone -
LABEL:HARDY AMIES
FABRIC:SATIN
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 8/10
SIZE ON LABEL:
COLOUR:BLACK
LENGTH:24"
BUST:34"
WAIST:30"
HIPS:-
SHOULDERS:16"
SLEEVES:24"
BACK:14" across widest point to edge of sleeves

name: 1970s Miss Mouse sunray pleated purple satin midi skirt
description:
Showstopping early 1970s skirt by Rae Spencer Cullen for Miss Mouse. A rich royal purple satin which is pleated vertically and then has a diamond pattern pressed into the skirt - the skirt is almost a full circle, so looks beautiful when moving In very good vintage condition - the pleats are all sharp and the skirt in good shape. However, it looks as if the waistband has been adjusted at some point to make the skirt slightly smaller - there is alteration to the hook and eyes and a small piece of fabric has been sewn into the waistband - not visible from the outside. This minor flaw is reflected in a slightly lower price for a piece of highly collectable Miss Mouse Will best fit a UK 10 UK 12
LABEL:MISS MOUSE LONDON
FABRIC:SATIN
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 10
SIZE ON LABEL:
COLOUR:PURPLE
LENGTH:32"
BUST:-
WAIST:26"
HIPS:FREE
SHOULDERS:-
SLEEVES:-

name: Rare 1970s Catherine Buckley patchwork antique jacquard maxi dress
description:
Early 1970s maxi dress by British designer Catherine Buckley in her trademark antique jacquard patchwork fabrics, manufactured between 1905 - 1935. Pretty cream base with various patchwork designs including several types of flower, the dress is a high collared design with a tiered skirt and voluminous sleeves. Removable sash tie to the waist, zips up to the back. In very good vintage condition - however, as the patchwork fabric is almost 100 years old there may be minor flaws in places, but nothing obvious. The lining is quite discoloured, which may be fixable through cleaning - due to the delicate nature of the outer fabric I would suggest that this would need the attention of a professional fabric restorer rather than a dry cleaners. Overall very good and wearable as is Will best fit a UK 8/10 -
LABEL:CATHERINE BUCKLEY
FABRIC:JACQUARD/ACETATE
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 8/10
SIZE ON LABEL:
COLOUR:MULTI
LENGTH:55"
BUST:34"
WAIST:27"
HIPS:FREE
SHOULDERS:12.5"
SLEEVES:24.5"

name: 1970s Fiorucci kitsch floral and gingham micro mini dress/tunic
description:
Early 1970s maxi dress by iconic Italian brand Fiorucci - reminds me of early, kitschy work by Betsey Johnson for Alley Cat as well as British brands of the era such as Stirling Cooper. Great use of contrasting cotton fabrics - red and white gingham empire line bust, red and yellow ric rac trim, and black mini floral lawn print body and puff sleeves. Zips up to the back. In very good vintage condition - it looks however as if the dress may have been shortened at some point, but to a good standard. Alterations reflected in the price Will best fit a UK 8 -
LABEL:FIORUCCI
FABRIC:COTTON
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 8
SIZE ON LABEL:
COLOUR:MULTI
LENGTH:30"
BUST:30" (empire line under bust - will fit up to a small C cup above)
WAIST:free due to empire cut
HIPS:38" (MAX)

name: 1970s Gina Fratini black & white monochrome Victoriana striped maxi dress
description:
early 1970s maxi dress by Gina Fratini. Black and white graphic stripes on a sheer polyester chiffon. Lined through the body and skirt, with sheer puffed sleeves finished with lace. Bodice has a pretty Victorian-inspired lace and button detail, round collar, zips up to the back In very good vintage condition - it looks however as if the skirt hem and cuffs may have been slightly shortened at some point, but to a very high standard. Alterations reflected in the price Will best fit a UK 8/10 -
LABEL:GINA FRATINI
FABRIC:POLYESTER CHIFFON/ACETATE

name: 1970s Gina Fratini Liberty print floral tiered gypsy dress
description:
Rare and unusual Western-style blouse by Rae Spencer-Cullen at Miss Mouse. Bottle green shirt with pearl snap buttons and lots of cowboy influence including peak detailing to back of the collar, piping trim to cuffs and back, slash pockets and hand-embroidered detail to the yoke. Feels like a cotton mix The shirt is in generally very good condition - some of the embroidery is a little loose and 'rubbed' in places but looks fine as is. Overall great Will best fit a UK 10/12 40

description:
Pretty 1980s shirt from Kenzo, Paris. Lovely duck egg blue colour with a striking pleated collar detail with fastens with one button to the neckline. 100% Cotton The blouse is in very good vintage condition Will best fit a UK 12 M

name: early 1960s navy lace Hardy Amies cocktail/wiggle dress
description:
Beautiful early 1960s dress by British society couturiers to the Queen, Hardy Amies. Fitted wiggle dress style, the dress is lace backed onto netting, with a navy acetate slip. Zips up to the side, false belt detail to the waist. In generally very good vintage condition, looks fine from the exterior. However, the dress has had some alterations structurally - has been taken in at the waist and hips, and possibly shortened. The lining has been cut and is currently not hemmed - not particularly noticeable when worn and easily fixed. The straps to the lining are cream rather than navy - not sure if this is original or not. The satin false belt has been altered. The lace is also slightly faded from general washing, but uniformly so. Despite these alterations, the dress is overall very good and the condition is reflected in the price. Will best fit a UK 8/10 -
LABEL:HARDY AMIES
FABRIC:feels like cotton lace/acetate

LENGTH:40"
BUST:34"

name: 1980s Antony Price black silk halter bra top/bustier
description:
Beautiful black silk bustier top by the king of sexy glam, Antony Price. The silk has been cleverly pleated to give a flattering shape which follows the form of the garment, hooks closed at the back and the halterneck. Will best fit a UK 8/10 up to a small C cup - please note the bra top is slightly too big for the mannequin Will best fit a UK 8/10 12

name: 1970s Annacat broderie anglaise regency cut maxi dress
description:
Regency-style maxi dress by cult British designers Annacat. Blue and white cotton gingham with white broderie anglaise embroidery all over and little cut outs to this fabric revealing the blue lining. empire bust and puff sleeves. Zips up to the back In reasonable vintage condition - structurally sound and in good overall shape, the dress has had some alterations. The sleeves have been crudely cut down and finished with white ribbon - fraying to the edges. It may be that the hem has been turned up too, but done to a good standard. The sleeves could be altered to a better finish - perhaps with lace trim, but these flaws are reflected in the lower than usual price for a piece of rare Annacat. Will best fit a UK 6/8 10
LABEL:ANNACAT
FABRIC:cotton/lined in acetate
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 6/8
SIZE ON LABEL:
COLOUR:BLUE/WHITE
LENGTH:54"
BUST:32"
WAIST:26" (EMPIRE CUT)
HIPS:36"
SHOULDERS:12"
SLEEVES:9.5"

name: 1960s Cathy McGowan's Boutique brown polka dot mini dress
description:
Cute mid-1960s mini dress by the 'Queen of the Mods', Ready Steady Go! presenter Cathy McGowan. Made from a dark brown synthetic fabric which feels similar to cotton and covered in printed white polka dots. Buttons up to the front, button down spread collar. Includes original spare button. In generally good vintage condition - however, there are some flaws to note. The polka dots are printed on and some are worn in places - not that obvious due to the nature of the design. It looks as if the dress has had some alterations over the years - probably shortened at the hem, and possibly some of the seams have either been re-stitched or moved to make the dress slightly smaller - some of them are now a little loose in places. Wearable as is, flaws reflected in the price. Will best fit a UK 8/10 -
LABEL:CATHY MCGOWAN'S BOUTIQUE
FABRIC:none stated, feels like synthetic with a cotton feel

name: Bridget of Strawberry Studio leopard print stretch halter dress
description:
A truly rock 'n' roll offering from the masters of glam 70s fashion - I've never seen a piece of Strawberry Studio which didn't truly rock, and this is no exception. A slinky leopard-print dress with ruched front and adjustable drawstring halter neck. The dress is made from a slightly stretchy velour-type fabric and zips up to the back. The dress itself is in excellent condition - however, the ribbon tie is frayed and could do with being replaced - wearable as is. Will best fit a UK 6/8 10
LABEL:BRIDGET OF STRAWBERRY STUDIO
FABRIC:Not stated, feels like synthetic velour

name: mid-1960s Gerald McCann black & white polka dot tiered party dress
description:
Stunning mid 1960s black & white polka dot dress by the party dress master, Gerald McCann. A simple A-line shape underneath in acetate, topped with tiers of black & white polka dots. Finished off with cute button detailing to the neckline. In excellent condition - I believe the ribbon detailing to the neckline was originally black and has discoloured to dark red - looks fine as it is though. Will best fit a UK 8 8
LABEL:GERALD MCCANN
FABRIC:Not stated, feels like synthetic satin, lined in acetate

name: mid 1960s Annacat grosgrain ribbon-trimmed mini dress
description:
Annacat was formed in 1965 by it girls Jane Lyle and Maggie Keswick, and this mini dress seems to date to the early years of the brand, being in a classic mod style. A heavy black grained fabric, empire line bust, it is trimmed in grosgrain ribbon. Zips up to the back. Trapeze shaped skirt from the empire line down. In excellent condition - the black fabric has faded very slightly over the years, but in a uniform fashion, and it does not take away from the overall look of the garment. Will best fit a UK 8
LABEL:ANNACAT
FABRIC:not stated, possibly a drill cotton

name: 1960s Polly Peck black devore velvet flower mini dress
description:
Cute mid 1960's black devore velvet/chiffon mini dress by Sybil Zelker at Polly Peck. The dress has a white acetate underdress and a black chiffon layer on top, with pretty burnout flower design. Cutaway sleeves and black velvet collar. Zips up to the back. An absolutely perfect party dress. In good vintage condition - however, there are a few small holes to the chiffon in places - could be easily fixed but not that noticeable due to the busy fabric. These minor flaws are reflected in the price Will best fit a UK 8/10 10

name: vintage 1980s Bus Stop pink heart print tea dress
description:
1980s Bus Stop tea dress with all the details that makes Bus Stop clothing so iconic - classic 1940s style, an element of girly kitsch, and a great cut that makes Lee Bender's designs so wearable today. The dress is a lilac pink shade, covered in hearts, so perfect for Valentine's Day. It has oversized plastic buttons, another classic Bus Stop detail, a round belt buckle, puff sleeves and a shawl collar. I think the fabric is viscose. I believe that this dress dates from a early 1980s collaboration with mail order company Grattan - see photo in bottom left corner of this image - http://www.flickr.com/photos/trevira/4814964991/in/photostream/lightbox/ In good vintage condition - however, there is a hole to the shoulder (as pictured) - this could be professionally repaired. The buttons have slightly faded, but uniformly so. Otherwise generally fine. Will best fit a UK 8/10
LABEL:BUS STOP
FABRIC:Viscose
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 8/10
SIZE ON LABEL:10
COLOUR:MULTI
LENGTH:40"
BUST:36"
WAIST:30"
HIPS:42"
SHOULDERS:28"
SLEEVES:20"

name: 1970s Ann Buck & Katharine Hamnett for Tuttabankem suede waistcoat/vest
description:
Simple and easy to wear 1970s black suede waistcoat by Ann Buck & Katharine Hamnett for Tuttabankem, who at the time that this garment was made were one of the first designers to set up in the Covent Garden area of London, alongside Tommy Roberts with his City Lights Studio. Looks great worn with a 1970s blouse underneath (for sale in a separate listing). In excellent vintage condition. Will best fit a UK 8
LABEL:ANN BUCK & KATHARINE HAMNETT FOR TUTTABANKEM
FABRIC:Suede
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 8

name: mid-1960s Gerald McCann wool & velvet peter pan collar dress
description:
Absolutely adorable mid 1960s dress by Gerald McCann retailed through Miss Selfridge - in my opinion, one of the most underrated designers of the boutique era. The dress is cream wool with mauve velvet sleeves and peter pan collar, with cream wool cuffs that are finished with black faceted button detailing. There is a panel running through the centre of the dress, with pretty black lace and satin flower detailing. Satin bow to the neck. Condition is generally very good - there are a few very minor nibbles to the wool in places, and a few that have been repaired, but overall fine for a 45+ year old garment. I think that the dress may have been shortened at some point, but discreetly so - there is a small area where the fabric has 'drooped' slightly at the front but this could be easily fixed Labelled a size UK 12, this is more like a modern UK 8/10.
LABEL:GERALD MCCANN/MISS SELFRIDGE
FABRIC:Wool/Velvet/Lace
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 8-10
SIZE ON LABEL:12
COLOUR:CREAM/MAUVE/BLACK
LENGTH:34"
BUST:34"
WAIST:26"
HIPS:38"
SHOULDERS:28"
SLEEVES:23"

name: 1970s floral print Clobber 2 by Jeff Banks sheer shirt-dress
description:
Early 1970s semi-sheer cotton shirt dress by Jeff Banks for his Clobber label - the original owner of this dress said she used to wear it unbuttoned with hot pants and a jersey top underneath, but it of course would work just as well as seen in the photographs. Pretty graphic floral pattern. Pointed collars and buttons arranged in threes to the front give this garment some extra detailing. Appears to be a lightweight cotton. In very good vintage condition - however, there are some areas of spotting to the fabric (as pictured) - they may come out with specialist dry-cleaning, however as the print is busy they are not that noticeable. Will best fit a UK 10
LABEL:CLOBBER 2 LONDON W1
FABRIC:Not stated but feels like cotton

name: rare 1970s Richard Smith for Chelsea Cobbler deadstock grey stacked heel platforms UK 3
description:
Rare 1970s platform shoes by Richard Smith for Chelsea Cobbler of Sackville Street, London, W1 - deadstock, complete with original box, tissue paper and leather off-cuts. I think these may have been samples due to the small size and the extra leather. Dark grey leather with wooden stacked heel and small platform. Fringing to the front with punch out detail - they have an elasticated Mary Jane-style strap and pearl/metal button to the side. They are in exceptionally good condition and look to have never been worn. Only thing to note that there is some creasing to the fringing but otherwise as new. There is no size marked to the shoes or the box but will best fit a smaller UK 3. Sole is approximately 7.8" long, 2.7" wide at widest sole area. Platform is just under 0.5" high and heels are 4.1" high.
LABEL:RICHARD SMITH FOR CHELSEA COBBLER
FABRIC:Leather
APPROXIMATE SIZE:small UK 3
SIZE ON LABEL:N/A

name: 1980s Jean Charles De Castelbajac cat print dress
description:
Rare and highly collectable 1980s dress by avant-garde French designer Jean Charles de Castelbajac. The dress is a cotton tunic cut with polo shirt collar and large patch pockets to the front. Vivid cat illustration. In generally very good vintage condition, however a few flaws to note - a few areas of spotting near the collar (pictured), collar has slightly discoloured. Overall very good and wearable as is. Labelled a size Medium, this will best fit a modern UK 8 - 12 depending on how you wish it to fit.

FABRIC:Cotton (possibly a mix)

name: 1980s Bellville Sassoon polka dot green silk peplum dress
description:
Early 1980s jade green dress by upmarket British designers Bellville Sassoon. Pure silk with a polka dot design woven through the fabric, cinched and gathered waist detail, peplum skirt, crystal buttons to the cuffs and body of dress. In excellent vintage condition. Labelled a size UK 10, this will best fit a modern UK 10.

name: early 1970s Foale & Tuffin sheepskin lined floral maxi coat
description:
Rare maxi-coat by Carnaby Street-based designers Marion Foale & Sally Tuffin, dating from the early 1970s. The coat is made from a bold floral cotton and lined in dark brown faux-sheepskin. Fabric covered buttons and pockets to the side, kimono sleeves. In generally sound condition - it does have a few flaws to note. There are a few areas of small wear/rubbing to the fabric in places - not really obvious due to the busy fabric. One button is missing and another is missing the fabric cover - I would suggest this is easily fixable by removing the bottom two loops and moving the buttons from this area to replace the missing/flawed buttons further up - see photo. The faux sheepskin is also quite 'bobbly' as is usually the case with this fabric. Generally, these flaws are all easy to remedy and overall the coat is very good - Foale & Tuffin is extremely rare so the price reflects these flaws but also the rarity of the garment. Labelled a UK 8, it will best fit a UK 8/10.
LABEL:MARION FOALE AND SALLY TUFFIN
FABRIC:cotton with faux sheepskin lining
APPROXIMATE SIZE:UK 8/10
SIZE ON LABEL:UK 8
COLOUR:MULTI
LENGTH:55"
BUST:36"
WAIST:-
HIPS:42"
SHOULDERS:30"
SLEEVES:22"

name: rare early 1960s Jane & Jane (Jean Muir) hot pink wool party dress
description:
Rare early example of the work of British designer Jean Muir for her first label, Jane & Jane, which launched in 1962. The dress is made from hot pink wool and full lined, zips up to the back. Button and bow detailing the front, fit and flare style. Condition is very good for vintage, with no noticeable flaws. Labelled a size UK 12, this is more like a modern UK 10.

FABRIC:note stated but feels like wool
